uuid.description: This is a unique identifier for this submission.

systemName.description: This should be the name of the application, website, system, credentials, etc. Note: this may also be the systemIdentifier for basic entries.

systemDescription.description: Provide a general description of this system or the purpose for context.

systemType.description: Each item or system you intend to register should have a record inside this array.

other.description: Provide a free text description of the system type if not available in systemTypes options.

systemOrg.description: Provide the department or group that this system belongs to or is responsible for support.

riskClass.description: Provide the Risk Classification of this system, taking into account data classification, availability requirements, and external obligations. Please see https://cybersecurity.yale.edu/mss/calculator for more information.

items.description: If your system is defined as High Risk you are required to submit the type of High Risk classes that apply to you.
enum: Database used for critical & high risk functions
Workstation/System used by a HIPAA covered entity

securityContact.description: The Security Contact should be submitted as either just an Accountable Party (the dept/group responsible for the system and its risk, not the IT Support person), who will want to be contacted in the case of any security incidents, or both an Accountable Party and a Security Contact (delegated), for if the accountable party wants another group or person contacted in the case of a security incident.

scType.description: Functional Contact= The dept/group responsible for the system and its risk, not the IT Support person, Technical Contact (delegated)= If the accountable party wants another group or person contacted in the case of a security incident.

scEmail.description: The Email address of this contact.

scPhone.description: The Phone Number of this contact.

scNetid.description: The Netid of this contact. If the contact is a department, the dept managers netid.

scDept.description: The Department or Group of this contact.

scChannel.description: Please enter how this contact would prefer to be contacted, via ServiceNow tickets, email, or phone.

systemIdentifier.description: This should be the hostname, computer name, device name, service account name, GUID, etc for the system. This will be our primary way of identifying your system as unique. This may be the same as systemName in some circumstances. If you have a system that requires multiple MACs/IPs to be entered for the same server/system please use the same identifier but add another entry in the array for each MAC/IP pairing.

componentType.description: For Applications and systems with multiple item types. This should be the specific type of this item, server, credentials, computer, etc. If this is a single registration for one device or system, you may omit this field.

MAC.description: The MAC address of this device, if multiple are used to connect this system to the network, please add additional items into the attributes array, one for each MAC.

ipType.description: If you have an IP that doesn't change or one that changes on each connection to the network.

ip.description: If you have an IP that doesn't change(Static), please submit that in the IP field. Omit this field if the IP changes.

url.description: This should be the website URL, API endpoint/URI, VIP name, or other URL used to access this system.

location.description: If this system is stored physically at Yale, in an office, cubicle, or data center, add that as the location. If it is in the cloud, put the region or zone and the name of the host (ex. AWS US-East-1).

manufacturer.description: The manufacturer of this device, if unknown, this field is not required.

model.description: The model of this device, if unknown, this field is not required.

os.description: The Operating System of this device, i.e. Windows 10, Windows XP, Linux Redhat, etc.
